page.title: 17Local History 1
page.content: Ashton was mentioned as Estone in the Domesday Book ,1086. Possibly this was a spelling mistake for Ashton.There used to be a local wood called Ash Wood and Ashton means settlement amongst the ash trees. It may have meant east town. The most important historical find has been the medieval pottery kiln which was found by Mr. George B. Leach, in 1933, in his garden in Pentre Lane. It is thought the monks from Vale Royal Abbey sited the kiln there because they had a supply of water, wood and clay. Our parish church, St. John the Evangelist, was built in 1849 and is a very good example of church building of that time. In 1985 an appeal has been launched to rebuild the top 3 metres of the steeple.
